name: pg-back-web
description: PgBackWeb is a web-based interface for managing PostgreSQL backups using pgBackRest. It allows scheduling, restoring, and managing backup operations through a modern self-hosted UI.
features: Backup scheduling: Automate PostgreSQL backups with configurable schedules for full, incremental, and differential backups.
Web interface: Manage all backup operations through a modern, responsive web UI without command-line access.
Restore operations: Quickly restore databases to specific points in time with guided recovery workflows.
Backup monitoring: Track backup status, success rates, and storage usage with dashboard visualizations.
Multiple databases: Configure and manage backups for multiple PostgreSQL instances from a single interface.
Retention policies: Automatically delete old backups based on age or count to manage storage efficiently.
Email notifications: Receive alerts when backups fail, complete, or require attention.
Compression support: Reduce backup size with built-in compression options to save storage space.
Encryption: Secure backup data with encryption at rest and in transit for compliance and security.
Storage backends: Store backups locally or on remote storage like S3, Azure Blob, or network shares.
Backup verification: Automatically test backup integrity to ensure successful recovery when needed.
Audit logging: Track all backup and restore operations with detailed logs for compliance and troubleshooting.
